Synopsis:
The true story of an ordinary man who won the heart of the Queen and started a revolution. Centered in the triangle formed by the increasingly insane Christian VII of Denmark, the idealist and illustrated Johann Friedrich Struensee and she even decided Queen Caroline Mathilde, the film tells the exciting life of a brave idealists who risk everything for the liberation of people, and especially the exciting and forbidden romance that changed an entire nation.

Production notes:
Danish director Nikolaj Arcel, A Real Subject is nominated for an Oscar for best foreign language film. Is supported by the Berlin Silver Bear for Best Screenplay for screenwriter own Arcel and Rasmus Heisterberg, and the Silver Bear for Best Actor for Mikkel Boe Folsgaard brilliant in his role as mad King Christian VII of Denmark.
